trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Service Bus queues in Azure. Code samples written in Java.

trans-unit.source: How to use Service Bus queues
trans-unit.target: How to use Service Bus queues

trans-unit.source: This guide describes how to use Service Bus queues.
trans-unit.target: This guide describes how to use Service Bus queues.

trans-unit.source: The samples are
trans-unit.target: The samples are

trans-unit.source: written in Java and use the <link><linkText>Azure SDK for Java[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: written in Java and use the <link><linkText>Azure SDK for Java[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: scenarios covered include creating queues, **sending and receiving
trans-unit.target: scenarios covered include creating queues, **sending and receiving

trans-unit.source: messages, and **deleting queues.
trans-unit.target: messages, and **deleting queues.

trans-unit.source: Configure your application to use Service Bus

trans-unit.target: Management operations for Service Bus queues can be performed via the

trans-unit.target: A ServiceBusContract object is

trans-unit.source: constructed with an appropriate configuration that encapsulates the
trans-unit.target: constructed with an appropriate configuration that encapsulates the

trans-unit.target: SAS token with permissions to manage it, and the ServiceBusContract class is

trans-unit.source: the sole point of communication with Azure.
trans-unit.target: the sole point of communication with Azure.

trans-unit.source: Messages sent to (and received from ) Service Bus queues are instances
trans-unit.target: Messages sent to (and received from ) Service Bus queues are instances

trans-unit.source: of the BrokeredMessage class.
trans-unit.target: of the BrokeredMessage class.

trans-unit.source: BrokeredMessage objects have a set
trans-unit.target: BrokeredMessage objects have a set

trans-unit.source: of standard methods (such as getLabel, getTimeToLive,
trans-unit.target: of standard methods (such as getLabel, getTimeToLive,

trans-unit.source: setLabel, and setTimeToLive), a dictionary that is used to hold
trans-unit.target: setLabel, and setTimeToLive), a dictionary that is used to hold

trans-unit.source: custom application specific properties, and a body of arbitrary
trans-unit.target: custom application specific properties, and a body of arbitrary

trans-unit.source: application data.
trans-unit.target: application data.

trans-unit.source: An application can set the body of the message by
trans-unit.target: An application can set the body of the message by

trans-unit.source: passing any serializable object into the constructor of the
trans-unit.target: passing any serializable object into the constructor of the

trans-unit.source: BrokeredMessage, and the appropriate serializer will then be used to
trans-unit.target: BrokeredMessage, and the appropriate serializer will then be used to

trans-unit.source: serialize the object.
trans-unit.target: serialize the object.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, a java.IO.InputStream can be
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, a java.IO.InputStream can be

trans-unit.source: provided.
trans-unit.target: provided.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus queues support a maximum message size of 256 KB (the header,
trans-unit.target: Service Bus queues support a maximum message size of 256 KB (the header,

trans-unit.source: which includes the standard and custom application properties, can have
trans-unit.target: which includes the standard and custom application properties, can have

trans-unit.source: a maximum size of 64 KB).
trans-unit.target: a maximum size of 64 KB).

trans-unit.source: There is no limit on the number of messages
trans-unit.target: There is no limit on the number of messages

trans-unit.source: held in a queue but there is a cap on the total size of the messages
trans-unit.target: held in a queue but there is a cap on the total size of the messages

trans-unit.source: held by a queue.
trans-unit.target: held by a queue.

trans-unit.source: This queue size is defined at creation time, with an
trans-unit.target: This queue size is defined at creation time, with an

trans-unit.source: upper limit of 5 GB.
trans-unit.target: upper limit of 5 GB.

trans-unit.source: How to receive messages from a queue
trans-unit.target: How to receive messages from a queue

trans-unit.source: The primary way to receive messages from a queue is to use a
trans-unit.target: The primary way to receive messages from a queue is to use a

trans-unit.source: ServiceBusContract object.
trans-unit.target: ServiceBusContract object.

trans-unit.source: Received messages can work in two
trans-unit.target: Received messages can work in two

trans-unit.source: different modes: ReceiveAndDelete and PeekLock.
trans-unit.target: different modes: ReceiveAndDelete and PeekLock.

trans-unit.source: When using the ReceiveAndDelete mode, receive is a single-shot
trans-unit.target: When using the ReceiveAndDelete mode, receive is a single-shot

trans-unit.source: operation - that is, when Service Bus receives a read request for a
trans-unit.target: operation - that is, when Service Bus receives a read request for a

trans-unit.source: message in a queue, it marks the message as being consumed and returns
trans-unit.target: message in a queue, it marks the message as being consumed and returns

trans-unit.source: it to the application.
trans-unit.target: it to the application.

trans-unit.source: ReceiveAndDelete mode (which is the default
trans-unit.target: ReceiveAndDelete mode (which is the default

trans-unit.source: mode) is the simplest model and works best for scenarios in which an
trans-unit.target: mode) is the simplest model and works best for scenarios in which an

trans-unit.source: application can tolerate not processing a message in the event of a
trans-unit.target: application can tolerate not processing a message in the event of a

trans-unit.source: failure.
trans-unit.target: failure.

trans-unit.source: To understand this, consider a scenario in which the consumer
trans-unit.target: To understand this, consider a scenario in which the consumer

trans-unit.source: issues the receive request and then crashes before processing it.
trans-unit.target: issues the receive request and then crashes before processing it.

trans-unit.source: Because Service Bus will have marked the message as being consumed, then
trans-unit.target: Because Service Bus will have marked the message as being consumed, then

trans-unit.source: when the application restarts and begins consuming messages again, it
trans-unit.target: when the application restarts and begins consuming messages again, it

trans-unit.source: will have missed the message that was consumed prior to the crash.
trans-unit.target: will have missed the message that was consumed prior to the crash.

trans-unit.source: In PeekLock mode, receive becomes a two stage operation, which makes
trans-unit.target: In PeekLock mode, receive becomes a two stage operation, which makes

trans-unit.source: it possible to support applications that cannot tolerate missing
trans-unit.target: it possible to support applications that cannot tolerate missing

trans-unit.source: messages.
trans-unit.target: messages.

trans-unit.source: When Service Bus receives a request, it finds the next message
trans-unit.target: When Service Bus receives a request, it finds the next message

trans-unit.source: to be consumed, locks it to prevent other consumers receiving it, and
trans-unit.target: to be consumed, locks it to prevent other consumers receiving it, and

trans-unit.source: then returns it to the application.
trans-unit.target: then returns it to the application.

trans-unit.source: After the application finishes
trans-unit.target: After the application finishes

trans-unit.source: processing the message (or stores it reliably for future processing), it
trans-unit.target: processing the message (or stores it reliably for future processing), it

trans-unit.source: completes the second stage of the receive process by calling Delete
trans-unit.target: completes the second stage of the receive process by calling Delete

trans-unit.source: on the received message.
trans-unit.target: on the received message.

trans-unit.source: When Service Bus sees the Delete call, it
trans-unit.target: When Service Bus sees the Delete call, it

trans-unit.source: will mark the message as being consumed and remove it from the queue.
trans-unit.target: will mark the message as being consumed and remove it from the queue.

trans-unit.source: The example below demonstrates how messages can be received and
trans-unit.target: The example below demonstrates how messages can be received and

trans-unit.source: processed using PeekLock mode (not the default mode).
trans-unit.target: processed using PeekLock mode (not the default mode).

trans-unit.source: The example
trans-unit.target: The example

trans-unit.source: below does an infinite loop and processes messages as they arrive into
trans-unit.target: below does an infinite loop and processes messages as they arrive into

trans-unit.target: our "TestQueue":

trans-unit.source: How to handle application crashes and unreadable messages
trans-unit.target: How to handle application crashes and unreadable messages

trans-unit.source: Service Bus provides functionality to help you gracefully recover from
trans-unit.target: Service Bus provides functionality to help you gracefully recover from

trans-unit.source: errors in your application or difficulties processing a message.
trans-unit.target: errors in your application or difficulties processing a message.

trans-unit.source: If a
trans-unit.target: If a

trans-unit.source: receiver application is unable to process the message for some reason,
trans-unit.target: receiver application is unable to process the message for some reason,

trans-unit.source: then it can call the unlockMessage method on the received message
trans-unit.target: then it can call the unlockMessage method on the received message

trans-unit.source: (instead of the deleteMessage method).
trans-unit.target: (instead of the deleteMessage method).

trans-unit.source: This will cause Service Bus
trans-unit.target: This will cause Service Bus

trans-unit.source: to unlock the message within the queue and make it available to be
trans-unit.target: to unlock the message within the queue and make it available to be

trans-unit.source: received again, either by the same consuming application or by another
trans-unit.target: received again, either by the same consuming application or by another

trans-unit.source: consuming application.
trans-unit.target: consuming application.

trans-unit.source: There is also a timeout associated with a message locked within the
trans-unit.target: There is also a timeout associated with a message locked within the

trans-unit.source: queue, and if the application fails to process the message before the
trans-unit.target: queue, and if the application fails to process the message before the

trans-unit.source: lock timeout expires (e.g., if the application crashes), then Service
trans-unit.target: lock timeout expires (e.g., if the application crashes), then Service

trans-unit.source: Bus will unlock the message automatically and make it available to be
trans-unit.target: Bus will unlock the message automatically and make it available to be

trans-unit.source: received again.
trans-unit.target: received again.

trans-unit.source: In the event that the application crashes after processing the message
trans-unit.target: In the event that the application crashes after processing the message

trans-unit.source: but before the deleteMessage request is issued, then the message
trans-unit.target: but before the deleteMessage request is issued, then the message

trans-unit.source: will be redelivered to the application when it restarts.
trans-unit.target: will be redelivered to the application when it restarts.

trans-unit.source: This is often
trans-unit.target: This is often

trans-unit.source: called At Least Once Processing, that is, each message will be
trans-unit.target: called At Least Once Processing, that is, each message will be

trans-unit.source: processed at least once but in certain situations the same message may
trans-unit.target: processed at least once but in certain situations the same message may

trans-unit.source: be redelivered.
trans-unit.target: be redelivered.

trans-unit.source: If the scenario cannot tolerate duplicate processing,
trans-unit.target: If the scenario cannot tolerate duplicate processing,

trans-unit.source: then application developers should add additional logic to their
trans-unit.target: then application developers should add additional logic to their

trans-unit.source: application to handle duplicate message delivery.
trans-unit.target: application to handle duplicate message delivery.

trans-unit.source: This is often achieved
trans-unit.target: This is often achieved

trans-unit.source: using the getMessageId method of the message, which will remain
trans-unit.target: using the getMessageId method of the message, which will remain

trans-unit.source: constant across delivery attempts.
trans-unit.target: constant across delivery attempts.
